wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Sir Thomas Andrew Polson, KBE, CMG, TD (28 August 1865 – 22 August 1946) was an Anglo-Irish writer who was briefly the Member of Parliament (MP) for Dover.

response: The Dover by-election of 1921 was held on 12 January 1921.  The by-election was held due to the succession to the peerage of the incumbent Coalition Unionist MP, Vere Ponsonby as Ninth Earl of Bessborough.  It was won by the Independent candidate Thomas Andrew Polson.
